intro: Taxanthema thouinii, commonly known as the desert daisy, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of central Australia. It is characterized by its low-growing, succulent habit and produces small, showy flowers in shades of yellow and orange. The plant has adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments through its thick, fleshy leaves that store water. Its flowers bloom during the cooler months, typically between spring and early summer. Taxanthema thouinii plays an important ecological role in stabilizing sandy soils and providing nectar for native pollinators.
